image.altText: A woman standing in front of a microphone at a press conference, outside, with bushland in the background.

props.synopsis: A minimum mandatory prison sentence will be reintroduced for offenders who repeatedly breach a domestic violence order and harm their victim, the Northern Territory government has announced.

title.children: Mandatory sentences for repeat DVO breaches to be reinstated in the NT

image.altText: A man in front of a colourful wall

props.synopsis: A former Alice Springs school principal charged with allegedly assaulting several children has stepped down from town council citing "personal and professional obstacles".

title.children: Former Alice Springs principal resigns from council amid child assault charges

image.altText: Palmerston police station 4

props.synopsis: The teenage girl was held in a Northern Territory police watch house for three nights, with the national children's commissioner calling the incident a "scandalous" reflection of Australia's human rights record.

title.children: Detainment of 15yo in NT police watch house reignites human rights concerns

image.altText: A man in a basketball jersey in a gym-like workshop, sitting next to a crouching man in yellow jersey both looking at camera

props.synopsis: A one-of-its-kind basketball program in prison gave Aaron Hyde a shot at turning his life around. Now, he's evening the playing field for other young people.

title.children: First Nations-led prison program uses sport to tackle trauma

image.altText: A side-on photo of a man wearing a blue blazer and orange tie. There are blurred out trees in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the Northern Territory's biggest land councils has expressed alarm at the government's planned legislative changes, while pastoralists say the current sacred site laws are a "joke".

title.children: 'A complete joke': Shots fired in battle over changes to NT sacred site laws

image.altText: Fantasia Rose Portaminni 2

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has the highest rate of kids in care in Australia. For those leaving care at 18 years old, it can be a confusing and scary time.

title.children: Teens struggle to adjust to adult life after leaving out-of-home care

image.altText: Grey, blue, pink and yellow egg cartons sit for sale on a shelf

props.synopsis: After making the price of eggs a key election issue, Donald Trump is importing them from as far away as Turkiye and South Korea to tackle continuing shortages.

title.children: Donald Trump is shopping for hundreds of millions of eggs

image.altText: moody image of 50- and 100-dollar notes laid out over bank statements

props.synopsis: The federal budget includes a "modest" tax cut for every taxpayer, starting from next year.

title.children: Tax cut calculator: find out how the new cuts will affect you

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump speaking in front of the red and white stripes of a US flag.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump defends the top adviser who inadvertently looped a magazine editor into a war group chat, saying he'd "learned a lesson" from the "glitch".

title.children: 'Learned a lesson': Trump defends aide's group chat 'glitch'

image.altText: Pete Hegseth is surrounded by reporters holding microphones and phones.

props.synopsis: End-to-end encrypted messaging app Signal is secure for everyday use but shouldn't be used by government officials to have conversations regarding national security, cyber security experts say.

title.children: Signal is 'as safe as messaging apps get', but not for national security

image.altText: Julien Alfred, Gabrielle Thomas and Brittany Wilson

props.synopsis: World Athletics president Sebastian Coe believes the introduction of chromosome testing of female athletes will help maintain the "absolute focus of the integrity of competition".

title.children: World Athletics introduces chromosome testing in women's events

image.altText: A man in a suit with a red tie speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: Multiple times in his quest to become premier, David Crisafulli told voters a new stadium wasn't in his plans — yesterday, he announced one that will cost more than $3 billion.

title.children: David Crisafulli has broken a promise, but will anyone care in the long run?

image.altText: Hamdan Ballal is released from a police station in the West Bank

props.synopsis: The director said he was arrested for filming an attack on his neighbour's house in the village Susiya.

title.children: Oscar-winning Palestinian director released after arrest in West Bank

image.altText: A tank with smoke visible nearby

props.synopsis: Talks in Saudi Arabia between delegations from the United States and Russia have again failed to produce a comprehensive ceasefire between Moscow and Kyiv, although separate deals to cement an informal truce already in place in the Black Sea was signed.

title.children: Russia-Ukraine ceasefire flops again after hours of talks 'about nothing'

image.altText: A board at the Australian Securities Exchange showing red and green stocks during trade.

props.synopsis: Australian shares have risen following gains on Wall Street overnight, and business reacts to the federal budget, including the non-compete ban. Follow live.

title.children: Businesses react to non-compete ban, ASX opens higher, Paladin shares tumble

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Breaking news: Labor to push tax cuts through parliament today

image.altText: A man in handcuffs escorted by police.

props.synopsis: Seven men connected to an organised crime group have been arrested following an investigation into the theft of 1.4 tonnes of tobacco in Sydney.

title.children: NSW Police tobacco arrests as $6.9b black market hit to budget revealed

image.altText: Jim Chalmers holds his arms out while speaking at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: The forecasts in the federal budget paint a rosy picture of the future, claiming the mythical "soft landing" is "increasingly likely" for Australia's economy.

title.children: Is Australia's economy on track for a 'soft landing'? The budget papers say it is

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A wall of portraits with one removed

props.synopsis: It's unknown when the oil painting, criticised by Mr Trump as "purposefully distorted" and "truly the worst", will be replaced.

title.children: Trump's portrait removed from Colorado's state capitol

image.altText: Pope Francis on the balcony at a hospital in Rome

props.synopsis: After a breathing crisis that involved the pontiff nearly choking on his vomit, "there was a real risk he might not make it," said Sergio Alfieri, a physician at Rome's Gemelli hospital.

title.children: Pope was so ill doctors considered letting him die

image.altText: A phone displaying a text that reads "hi Mum, it's me! Phones broken. Using this temp for now, how are you?"

props.synopsis: Three years on from when the first "Hi Mum" texts appeared on Australian mobile phones, parents are still falling for this emotive scam.

title.children: Calls to charity from 'Hi Mum' victims jump as text scam persists

image.altText: Senior Sergeant Jay Notaro in front of the water police building at the Southport Spit.

props.synopsis: Authorities are searching for prominent South East Queensland police officer Jay Notaro, after his surfboard was found abandoned on a northern NSW beach.

title.children: Search resumes for Qld police officer missing near Byron Bay

image.altText: woman taking a selfie in a car

props.synopsis: Ahmad Hodroj pleads guilty to the domestic violence manslaughter of his estranged wife and mother of three Amira Moughnieh in their Sydney home.

title.children: Murder charge dropped as Sydney man pleads guilty to wife's DV manslaughter

image.altText: A SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule manoeuvres in space following undocking from the ISS to begin a journey to return to Earth.

props.synopsis: When SpaceX launches its next mission in the coming days, it will include an Australian-led experiment that could have significant ramifications for the future of space exploration.

title.children: Astronauts to grow edible mushrooms during next space mission

image.altText: Tony Popovic has his thumb up

props.synopsis: With six points out of six and an extension to Tony Popovic's unbeaten start to life as Socceroos coach, Australia is daring to dream of a stress-free passage to the 2026 FIFA World Cup. But the job is not done yet, not by a long shot.

title.children: Socceroos can dream of World Cup qualification, but not yet

image.altText: A generic QPS badge on the wall.

props.synopsis: Queensland Human Rights Commissioner Scott McDougall says the rejected recommendations gave the service provide "an achievable path forward".

title.children: Queensland police reject diversity targets recommendation

image.altText: Five staff members of a resort stand on the beach and wave happily with their left hands

props.synopsis: Yes, there is yet another streaming service arriving on our shores. But things are a little different with this one, and it could up-end the Australian TV landscape.

title.children: HBO's streaming service is coming to Australia. It could change everything

image.altText: Alex Carey on one knee, playing a sweep shot past a fielder in short, who is strectching to his left trying to stop the ball

props.synopsis: South Australia has been the dominant team all summer and is hosting the Sheffield Shield final against Queensland, who rallied in the second half of the season. Check out the live scores and stats in our ScoreCentre.

title.children: Sheffield Shield final live: South Australia bowling first against Queensland

image.altText: A single rose placed on a riot shield in a line of police officers at night.

props.synopsis: Protesters have taken to the streets in recent days after the arrest of a leading political opponent to Türkiye's longtime leader Tayyip Erdogan.

title.children: Türkiye protests enter seventh day as Erdogan insists 'show' will end

image.altText: Aerial view of water and station in Queensland

props.synopsis: More heavy rainfall is forecast after a drenching in outback and north Queensland closes roads and strands inland residents.

title.children: Outback towns now 'islands' as record-breaking rain continues

image.altText: A woman smiles with arms folded and road behind her

props.synopsis: In Sydney's inner city, three former tunnelling sites remain vacant and unused. The NSW government has ruled out setting aside the lots for social housing — a decision some suggest is wrong.

title.children: 'Absolute waste': Housing crisis fuels debate over rare Sydney properties

image.altText: Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen in a blue dress.

props.synopsis: Mette Frederiksen hit out after it emerged that a delegation including Usha Vance, wife of vice president JD Vance, White House National Security Adviser Mike Waltz and Energy Secretary Chris Wright will make an unsolicited visit to the country.

title.children: Trump team putting 'unacceptable pressure' on Greenland, says Danish PM

image.altText: Actor Gerard Depardieu attends a news conference and points his finger at the crowd.

props.synopsis: The French actor has taken the stand in Paris, where he is on trial for sexual assault during the filming of Les Volets Verts in 2021.

title.children: Gerard Depardieu admits grabbing woman by hips but denies assault

image.altText: A woman with curly red hair sits in front of a bookshelf smiling.

props.synopsis: The Australian National University's vice-chancellor vows to stay the course amid sustained pressure on her leadership, while blasting her most vocal critics for using her gender as a tactic to undermine her.

title.children: ANU vice-chancellor staying the course to 'rosy future' amid pressure

image.altText: An old woman and a little girl listening to music with headphones

props.synopsis: Music lovers show how special musical memories are, with recollections going back decades. Here's how music from childhood can form lifelong memories

title.children: Unlike words and faces, musical memories don’t fade with time
